definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: An Egypt that has amended its constitution to hold multiparty elections.
sentences.chinese: 埃及通過修憲舉行多黨選舉。

sentences.english: There is no opposition party and multi party democracy in China and hence it is unfair to compare China with India.
sentences.chinese: 獨黨制的中國和多黨民主制的印度比較是不公平的。

sentences.english: By a party or by the multi-party appear to lead a society.
sentences.chinese: 由某個政黨或由多黨出面來領導一個社會。

sentences.english: No one is openly calling for multi-party politics, at least not in the press.
sentences.chinese: 無人公開呼求多黨政治，至少媒體上沒有。

sentences.english: A number of these states are moving timidly towards multi-party democracy.
sentences.chinese: 這些國家中有很多正小心翼翼地向多黨民主制發展。

sentences.english: Hu Shih s thought of multiparty politics came into being during his study in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美國留學期間，胡適形成了“多黨政治”的思想。

sentences.english: And does that lead ineluctably to a multi-party political system?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，這一定會導致多黨政治制度嗎？
